item.title: Creating a Personal Notification System for free with Telegram API
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Telegram is a messaging app, similar to WhatsApp and many others. It’s a well-maintained app, powered by many features that … Continue reading Creating a Personal Notification System for free with Telegram API →
item.content:encoded:
Telegram is a messaging app, similar to WhatsApp and many others.

It’s a well-maintained app, powered by many features that give it an edge over its competitors. Today, we are exploring Telegram’s API. Telegram features an incredibly simple API to automate almost anythingâ€“you can even use it to send messages to youself.

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <math.h>

// Structure to represent a point
struct Point
{
    int x, y;
};

// Function to plot a point
void plotPoint(int x, int y)
{
    printf("(%d, %d)\n", x, y);
}

// Function to implement Bresenham's line drawing algorithm
void bresenham(struct Point p1, struct Point p2)
{
    int dx = abs(p2.x - p1.x);
    int dy = abs(p2.y - p1.y);
    int p = 2 * dy - dx;
    int twoDy = 2 * dy;
    int twoDyMinusDx = 2 * (dy - dx);
    int x, y;

    // Determine which point to use as starting point
    if (p1.x > p2.x)
    {
        x = p2.x;
        y = p2.y;
    }
    else
    {
        x = p1.x;
        y = p1.y;
    }

    // Plot the starting point
    plotPoint(x, y);

    while (x < p2.x)
    {
        x++;
        if (p < 0)
            p += twoDy;
        else
        {
            y++;
            p += twoDyMinusDx;
        }

        // Plot the next point
        plotPoint(x, y);
    }
}

// Driver program to test above function
int main()
{
    struct Point p1 = {1, 1}, p2 = {10, 5};
    bresenham(p1, p2);
    return 0;
}
